Posts.Content: Jan 7, 2010 09:09AM sas14 wrote: vmarie, So sorry to hear you are going through this.  I had a biopsy done this morning, so I'm in the same boat you are.  Your range of thoughts and emotions are completely normal.    I am worried as well, but a good friend of mine was diagnosed over a year ago, and have seen through her experience that it is a very manageable disease.  I don't want to be facing cancer, surgery, radiation and/or chemo, but I also know I can handle it and that it's curable!  I just joined this site a week ago, but already have seen the great resource it provides from both an educational and a support perspective.  You are in my prayers.  GOD BLESS Shelly
Posts.Title: mental state Iamstronger Marie821

Posts.Content: Jan 11, 2010 09:22AM sas14 wrote: Congrats Lori!  I'm sure you're relieved.
Posts.Title: Still waiting AboutLori AboutLori

Posts.Content: Jan 6, 2010 07:56PM sas14 wrote: Had the core needle biopsy today, which was not a big deal.  It hurt while they put the titanium marker thing in though, they had some intern or resident helping and man they were doing a lot of pushing and stuff to find the exact spot. I won't have the results until Monday or Tuesday they said (uggh more waiting).  But the radiologist was somewhat encouraging and said she didn't think it "looked like anything scary".  She told me when I first got in there that if she had been the radiologist who read my first ultrasound, she wasn't even sure if she'd have ordered the biopsy. It is a solid mass that grew from .6 to 1.0 cm, but I guess the appearance is round like a fibroadenoma.   But the first radiologist told me the only way to know for certain is to biopsy it, so I am aware it could still be cancer. Thanks for the support!
Posts.Title: Biopsy scheduled next week sas14 awb

Posts.Content: sas14 wrote: I am a 48 year old female, with a history of cysts (for many years now) and a fibroadenoma (when I was in my 20s). My breasts are dense, and very lumpy (I have as many as 12-15 cysts per breast at any one time). When I had my last mammo/ultrasound in May, they found a couple solid masses (via ultrasound, they don't show on the mammogram) on the left breast and told me to come back after six months for a recheck (I was a tad late). Had the follow up ultrasound today , and one of the masses decreased in size, but the other INCREASED from .6 cm to 1.0 cm in about 8 months. So now I have to have an ultrasound guided biopsy done next week, then wait close to another week for the results. I am a numbers person, and I know the overall number of benign biopsies is around 80%. BUT, I found a chart which breaks it down by age group and diagnosis (cancer, fibroadenoma, cyst, other benign), and the incidence of fibroadenomas is much lower in my age group (only 10%), and cyst can be ruled out based on the ultrasound results. Basically I'm left with 40% combined fibroadenoma and other, vs. 35% cancer. Almost even odds its cancer.   I am beside myself with fear and anxiety (I have an anxiety disorder anyhow), and would like some advice on how to get through the next couple weeks without making myself crazy. Thanks to all who take the time to read this and respond. Michele Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Biopsy scheduled next week sas14 awb

Posts.Content: Jan 5, 2010 07:17PM sas14 wrote: Thanks everyone for your replies.  I am trying to remain optimistic, but am prepared for either outcome.  One thing I forgot to mention is I'm at higher risk due to being on HRT for over 15 years, due to premature ovarian failure.  My biopsy is first thing tomorrow morning, but they said 3 to 4 business days to get the results, so most likely I won't know until next week.  Keep me in your prayers please. God Bless All of YOU Michele (Shelly)
Posts.Title: Biopsy scheduled next week sas14 awb

Posts.Content: Jan 11, 2010 08:53AM sas14 wrote: The radiologist called with the results this morning...and said the path report just said fibrocystic changes.  So I guess that is great news!  Thanks to everyone for their prayers and kind words. This experience has been an eye opener and I will continue to say prayers for all of you.   God Bless each and every one of you.  Michele
